Reviews.Title: A few issues - works fine - summary of research and usage
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: First off - I bought this phone as a "temporary" replacement for an AT&T; phone.  I did some initial research, took the plunge and bought it.  I went into this knowing that it is an unlocked T-Mobile phone being run on the AT&T; network.  As forewarned some features may not be supported.  I have three issues that I can live with for the short term until I can get a decent contract phone (like the Motorola Atrix) without paying full retail.1st issue:  Sending/Receiving embedded pics via text messaging does not work2nd issue:  Does not recognize the AT&T; 3G service (if someone out there does have it showing the AT&T; 3G - please let me know).3rd issue:  Processor is underpowered.More research and drudging through the Android forums - I found that someone else acknowledged the lack of supporting the AT&T; 3G service.  If you can update to Android 1.6 (I have not yet and won't till I have my contract replacement phone and will risk doing the update then), that seems to improve performance - at least in some of the reviews I have read.  Unless you are running this over a T-Mobile network - you will not be able to do an over-the-air update.  The 1.6 update is available at:  [...]  There seems to be two updates you have to apply.  Once I do this (probably in a few months - I will update here).I do like the phone.  It is nicely sized, has a good feature-set.  The camera and video quality is pretty decent with a good set of controls.  The call quality is excellent as is playing music out of it.  I do use it as an alarm clock - though be forwarned.  For some reason - the alarm clock version that comes with the phone does not allow you to add music from your mp3 collection to wake up to.  But the Timer app does.  Go figure.BATTERY ISSUE1 other issue that I am NOT down rating the phone for.  I bought this phone back at the beginning of June.  Battery life was as advertised - but this week has rapidly declined in performance daily.  Today as example - started off the day with a fully charged phone - only sent/received 3 text messages.  I am assuming this is a product that sat on the shelf for a long period of time.  It is under warranty with the seller (BluetekUSA).  I have sent this issue to them and am hoping to resolve this shortly.Hope this helps.  Good phone.  If you are buying to run on the T-Mobile network - by all means go for it.  If you are a novice user and don't want to mess with updates - see if your reseller in this marketplace will do the 1.6 update for you.  Doesn't hurt to ask!Robert

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these phones for family in Brazil.I have an iPhone and was quite impressed with this phone.The camera is just like a real digital camera with all the options (e.g. face recognition, portrait mode, flash, etc). Also, it does video which was also really good with stabilization.The color/clarity of the screen was impressive.I didn't get a chance to see all the features of the phone, but it definitely blows away my 3GS.Also, they said they were able to slip in their SIM cards in Brazil and it was working right away.

Reviews.Title: BEST PHONE IVE EVER HAD. HANDS DOWN!!!
Reviews.Author: cooldude23
Reviews.Content: ok so i was skeptical about this phone being another big flop by samsung but it actually proved me wrong, right off the bat the phone is very fun, the internet is fast, the camera is almost digital camera status! everything about this phone is so high tech i love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE,
Reviews.Author: Denarcy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone supposedly brand new from tmoble and it SUCKED!CONS-It froze constantly and I had to take the battery out! And put it back in.-I could NOT look at the keyboard function to do conference calls!-It wouldnt hook up to the blue tooth in the car and when it did you COULDN'T hear the other person!I hated this phone so much I purchased a phone that was 4 years old and haven't regretted the change!Don't waste your time or money on this piece of garbage!

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: Caroline Carter
Reviews.Content: Phone arrived quickly and well packaged. Touchscreen is very responsive and the phone has many functions. Owner's manual was included but download a better copy on-line.

Reviews.Title: Overall not  a phone I would recommend at  all.
Reviews.Author: christine Nankinga
Reviews.Content: the  phone heats up  switches on and off and  also self  erases information. it doesn't  read the n SD card and just  really been a problem  phone  from start  though  thought it would  work  out.  overall it was  not a good experience with Samsung phone.

Reviews.Title: It got old.
Reviews.Author: KypDurron
Reviews.Content: This was a reasonable purchase. The product performed as described and the price was adequate. I recommend the purchase to everyone who understands the details.

Reviews.Title: Screen Dead within 1 month
Reviews.Author: Matthew Adair
Reviews.Content: The phone screen has already quit working within one month.The phone wasn't dropped, or abused in any way.I would not purchase this phone again.

Reviews.Title: Battry runs out fast every thing else it not bad
Reviews.Author: muhammad akash
Reviews.Content: Not bad for first timers good phone for any body gsm ok like itWould recomand it to any body.,

Reviews.Title: Avoid!
Reviews.Author: Sujit Kumar Mahapatra "Sujit"
Reviews.Content: I own this phone for last 2 years now. Bottom line is it's not worth it.Issues--------Android 1.6 (Cant go above that)Inconsistent behavior (Beware that video capture will crash any moment)Many annoying applications (Like the CUBE) which is mostly useless to mePoor battery life (Expect to charge it twice if your wifi is on)Slow... average response time is 1.5 to 2 seconds (Pretty slow for a smartphone).

Reviews.Title: Samsung Behold 2 T939 Great phone, but used battery :(
Reviews.Author: Phone Phreak
Reviews.Content: Item arrived on time great phone I previous owned the Samsung behold 1 only issue is this phone came with a previously used battery I fully charged it while it was off at work then it died 2 hours later while it was in idle mood I should have know I saw afew reviews that said their phones came with a used/weak battery

Reviews.Title: Hold before you buy
Reviews.Author: BIPIN JADHAV
Reviews.Content: I received this phone today (10/26) and found the phone box is not original samsung box and it was opened not sealed. The box had additional label which said New. Curiously opened it and standard accessories were missing - USB cable and ear phones. Started the phone and very sluggish performance which crashed 3 times and had to restart the phone. So returning immediately. Do not buy this phone. First time bad experience with Amazon order...!!!

Reviews.Title: Limted Android Platform
Reviews.Author: Bowleglewie
Reviews.Content: The people I bought it from had everything in the package as it stated including the Sim card so it was a new unit.  The unit itself has a limited Android as it is 1.5 and needs a upgrade.  The phone itself is nice enough as it does not have a option of downloading Apps as only you can get those compatible for this phone unless your on the Android Market to get them.  My brother has a Lg phone and his phone has alot more options than this phone.  The call quality however is good and the web has 3g speed which is ok.  If I known this I would have spent a little more for those type options with a better Android version but I will keep this one for now as I am not totally happy with this unit.  The 5.0 mp phone is really nice and that is the best feature of the phone.  I have a couple of Samsung Products is the reason I bought the phone but wish it was not so limited and Android Market oriented as I would have like to have the capability of downloading apps to the phone from the computer.If your new too Androids its ok

Reviews.Title: my review for Samsung Behold
Reviews.Author: ZM
Reviews.Content: This phone was sold with an old battery, I charge it and after talking for a little bit overhalf  hour and I need to charge it again. It was missing the memory card afer contacting the seller, it was replaced andit was also missing the usb cable. I am not 100% happy with the seller, I will not buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: Product rating received
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Enrique
Reviews.Content: excellent phone, the shipment arrived on time, comfortable, friendly, meet my expectations but came without headphones.I look forward to bid on this phone compatible accessoriesSamsung Behold 2 II T939 Unlocked Android Phone with 5MP Camera, Touchscreen, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth - Unlocked Phone - US Warranty - Brown

Reviews.Title: Dissatisfied customer
Reviews.Author: Michelle7
Reviews.Content: I did receive the product in a timely manner; but, the battery life was ridiculous! You should NOT have to charge a phone after every conversation. The producut came with no user manual nor instructions on how to use the phone. I just returned it for the above reasons.

Reviews.Title: good so far
Reviews.Author: orejon
Reviews.Content: phone is working well with Simple Mobile. Simple Mobile is like Boost and Virgin are to Sprint is What Simple Mobile is to T Mobile

Reviews.Title: Antiquated But Functional To A Point
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Fontana
Reviews.Content: I've had mine for about three months now.  I wanted to use it to give Android and t-mobile's no-contract service a test drive after being an AT&T; customer for many years.  This phone is a predecessor to the current Samsung Galaxy line of phones that are selling like hotcakes.  It is the very first SGT series phone to feature the Android OS, but it is an older (1.6) customized version produced in early 2009.  While that may not seem old, in the phone and electronic world, it is relatively ancient.  Because of this, you are going to see features and functions that are complicated to use.  While you have a touch screen, there are many functions which must be done with functional buttons, and there's half a dozen on this unit.  For example, you can't expand a picture or webpage by pinching the screen - you'll have to use the "mouse" button in the center of the phone.  Because of all the buttons on the phone, it is quite easy to hang up or place a call on hold while in conversation, or perform a myriad of undesirable functions when trying to navigate to an application or task.  Even though there's smartphone elements to this device, it is rather clumsy to use them compared to current Android technology.  Then there's the proximaty functionality in this phone - because of it's quirky, sensitive touch-screen, you can often cause a screen or app to turn on/off against your will.  This is probably a bug, because Samsung suggests resolving it with a case (which can be had quite cheaply - as little as a dollar), but it took me weeks to figure this out.Finally, the version of Android on this phone was customized (euthanized might be a better term) by Samsung in an attempt to differentiate if from the competition.  So while you get an excellent camera function, you get a quirky and useless "cube" application, several other games and marketing apps which are useles sand can't be removed, a browser which is rather slow, and a 3G bandwidth that seldom seems to pick up a 3g signal.  Luckily 2g is just fine in my area.All in all, you can get this phone for about 1/3 the price of a newer model with more useful bug-free features, so I'd suppose you're about getting what you pay for.  There are many blogs on the internet about "rooting" this phone and loading a non-custom version of the older Android OS on it.  While they address many of these issues, they cause many more, and most of this work was done a couple of years ago, so support for it is pretty much dead.My suggestion is to keep shopping until you find an unlocked GSM phone in this price range with at least an Android release level of 2.0 or more, and very little custom software plus at least 1g of memory to handle today's demanding apps.  Keep in mind that future apps will demand even more, and probably won't be available for the one that you pick!

Reviews.Title: Good service
Reviews.Author: Ecuadorian
Reviews.Content: I bougth this cell phone like 3 weeks ago, and i just got it, but you have to know that I live in Ecuador, so I had to buy it and wait for the time of delivering. The product I got looks like new, I bought it new, and the price was reasonable, the cell phone came with all the accesories they announced, so I'm very satisfied with the service BLUETUKSA gave me.

Reviews.Title: The worst phone
Reviews.Author: JOSE
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this phone. This is the worst phones I've had. The operating system freezes very often. And the capacity of reception is very limited. It has very good features, but they fail very often.

Reviews.Title: what did i buy???
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: Totally disappointing, I was looking for an android phone but for my surprise I bought a really bad item, the system continously crashes down, I've installed some apps to try fixing the  problem but nothing yet, try to find a contact as simple as that and I just can't because a message that says Initializing, try later... come on!!! I can't just get along with it anymore. It is a shame because the telephone looks pretty good but it's not enough. Bad for this cellphone.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Behold
Reviews.Author: gemini2484
Reviews.Content: This phone I ordered in March of this year and I am still not able to use it because it is not even unlocked. I cannot put my SIM card in to use. So think twice before ordering this phone.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Trixstra
Reviews.Content: This phone sucks!!!! After a month i had to get a new phone because this one freezes and the cheesy home screen makes the phone looks like a toy for preschool. Don't waste your money buying this piece of garbage

Android-powered, 3G-enabled smartphone with full touchscreen display and intuitive Samsung TouchWiz interface
GPS for navigation and location-based services via Google Maps
Wi-Fi networking (802.11b/g); 5-megapixel camera/camcorder; Bluetooth stereo music; microSD memory expansion to 16 GB
Up to 6 hours of talk time, up to 400 hours (16.7 days) of standby time; access to personal and corporate email
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint
